results.definition: the posterior part of a human (or animal) body from the neck to the end of the spine
examples: his back was nicely tanned

results.definition: the side that goes last or is not normally seen
examples: he wrote the date on the back of the photograph

results.definition: the part of something that is furthest from the normal viewer
examples: he stood at the back of the stage
it was hidden in the rear of the store

results.definition: (football) a person who plays in the backfield
the series of vertebrae forming the axis of the skeleton and protecting the spinal cord
examples: the fall broke his back

results.definition: the protective covering on the front, back, and spine of a book
examples: the book had a leather binding

results.definition: the part of a garment that covers the back of your body
examples: they pinned a `kick me' sign on his back

results.definition: a support that you can lean against while sitting
examples: the back of the dental chair was adjustable

results.definition: (American football) the position of a player on a football team who is stationed behind the line of scrimmage
be behind; approve of
examples: He plumped for the Labor Party
I backed Kennedy in 1960

results.definition: travel backward
examples: back into the driveway
The car backed up and hit the tree

results.definition: give support or one's approval to
examples: I'll second that motion
I can't back this plan
endorse a new project

results.definition: cause to travel backward
examples: back the car into the parking spot

results.definition: support financial backing for
examples: back this enterprise

results.definition: be in back of
examples: My garage backs their yard

results.definition: place a bet on
examples: Which horse are you backing?
I'm betting on the new horse

results.definition: shift to a counterclockwise direction
examples: the wind backed

results.definition: establish as valid or genuine
examples: Can you back up your claims?

results.definition: strengthen by providing with a back or backing
related to or located at the back
examples: the back yard
the back entrance

results.definition: located at or near the back of an animal
examples: back (or hind) legs
the hinder part of a carcass

results.definition: of an earlier date
examples: back issues of the magazine

results.definition: in or to or toward a former location
examples: she went back to her parents' house

results.definition: at or to or toward the back or rear
examples: he moved back
tripped when he stepped backward
she looked rearward out the window of the car

results.definition: in or to or toward an original condition
examples: he went back to sleep

results.definition: in or to or toward a past time
examples: set the clocks back an hour
never look back
lovers of the past looking fondly backward

results.definition: in reply
examples: he wrote back three days later

results.definition: in repayment or retaliation
examples: we paid back everything we had borrowed
he hit me and I hit him back
I was kept in after school for talking back to the teacher
